Description: Lip and wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat pottery plate; outside of rim and interior slipped; on exterior: band under rim and two sets of two bands on wall; on outer face of lip row of painted blobs; top of rim has seven grooves and frieze of verticals; interior, from outside, broad band with added red band lined in white; two bands; hindquarters of a fallow deer to left with added red and white dapples.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Cambridge NA55 and NA56.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.757)
